Australian Yang Hengjun handed suspended death sentence by Beijing courtAustralian writer Yang Hengjun, jailed in Beijing for five years on espionage charges, has been handed a suspended death sentence by a Beijing court, according to a family friend. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 02:45:54 GMT HMTNVGUQQBO4DHC5X2SVEIGOYY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/australian-yang-hengjun-handed-suspended-death-sentence-by-beijing-court-2024-02-05/Reuters世界亚太地区
Russia emergency helicopter crashes in Karelia lake with three aboardAn Mi-8 helicopter belonging to Russia's emergencies ministry crashed into a lake in the country's northern Karelia region with three crew members on board, the ministry said on Monday, adding that an underwater search was underway. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 01:52:17 GMT HBAKAWJIVBLO3MTMR6E655MU5E https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russia-emergency-helicopter-crashes-karelia-lake-with- Three-aboard-2024-02-05/Reuters世界欧洲
EL Salvador's Bukele declares himself winner of presidential voteEl Salvador's President Nayib Bukele declared himself the winner of presidential elections held on Sunday, hours after polls closed but before the electoral body announced official results. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 01:11:03 GMT MPKRDCA7EJOZLMTCKEENGLK6FQ https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/el-salvadors-bukele-declares-himself-winner-presidential-vote-2024-02-05/Reuters世界美洲
Biden weighing joining Las Vegas hotel workers on picket line, union chief saysPresident Joe Bidenmight join Las Vegas hotel employees on a picket line if they go on strike Monday, a move that would bind him closely with another group of workers in a 2024 electionbattleground state, the union's chief told Reuters. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 01:08:21 GMT 6MKY3O3VTRIO3HLNPIUUNGTYJI https://www.reuters.com/world/us/biden-weighing-joining-las-vegas-hotel-workers-picket-line-union-chief-2024-02-05/Jarrett Renshaw, Trevor Hunnicutt世界美国
US official urges Papua New Guinea to reject Chinese security dealA senior U.S. state department official urged Papua New Guinea(PNG) to turn down China's offer of a potential security pact, warning the Pacific nation that any security guarantee with Beijing comes with consequences and costs. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 23:53:59 GMT WCVUIM6JAJIPDB6LRJNEM3PPQY https://www.reuters.com/world/us-official-urges-papua-new-guinea-reject-chinese-security-deal-2024-02-04/Reuters世界
Exclusive: Eisai expects 1,500 Alzheimer's patients in China launch, sees ‘huge’ growthJapan’s Eisai aims to roll out its groundbreaking Alzheimer’s drug Leqembi to 1,500 people in China later this year, but expects growth to accelerate significantly in 2025 as diagnosis methods change, a company spokesperson told Reuters. Zelenskiy says he might replace several Ukraine officials, not just militaryUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, in an interview broadcast on Sunday, said he was considering a "reset" to replace several senior officials. No new import bans in next EU Russia sanctions package, sources sayThe European Commission will not add any new import bans in its next package of sanctions on Russia, EU diplomats said, as a 13th package proposal takes its final shape. Northern Ireland has 'brighter future' with power sharing return, Sunak saysNorthern Ireland faces a "brighter future" with the restoration of devolved government after two years of deadlock, Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on a visit to Belfast on Sunday. Sun, 04 Feb 2024 20:38:00 GMT C62LHQJCFVOB7HG6PYDXS7AWFU https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/n-ireland-has-brighter-future-with-power-sharing-return-sunak-says-2024-02-04/Amanda Ferguson世界英国
EU diplomat says defunding U.N. Palestinian agency would be dangerousThe European Union's top diplomat said on Sunday cutting funds to UNRWA would put hundreds of thousands of lives at risk, amid allegations some of the U.N. Palestinian refugee agency's staff were involved in the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks on Israel. Turkey agrees to provide drones to EgyptTurkey agreed to provide its increasingly popular drones to Egypt after the two countries normalised ties following a decade of rupture, Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said on Sunday.
